val:
Hi! I'm Sai Deepika Asandi, based in Boston and a Data Analytics grad student at Tufts with a GPA of 3.9, combining my love for data with hands-on learning. I’m currently interning with the MBTA, where I build data pipelines and create dashboards to enhance operational insights. At Tufts, I work as a Teaching Assistant, guiding students through Python, machine learning, and analytics.

My research journey has been both challenging and rewarding—from analyzing transportation data at Tufts to leading projects at HuT Labs, like autonomous vehicle lane segmentation and a voter ID and fingerprint-based e-voting system, which I published with IEEE. I also competed in IDC Robocon 2021 and 2022, collaborating internationally on robotics.

When I’m not diving into data, I’m usually lost in a good book, dancing, or exploring new perspectives through stories.

Here are a few of the other activities that I love to do!
